benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: PUT Valid Request coverage: multiple test cases validate 204 responses and correct field updates (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC17, TC19, TC22, TC23, TC24, TC25).

Error handling and input validation: 400/404/401/503/500 scenarios across TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC20. The suite covers malformed input, missing body, invalid IDs, unauthorized access, and dependency/service failures.
Boundary and edge-case coverage: max fields (TC13), max length value (TC14), empty value (TC15), extra URL param (TC16), removal via empty array (TC03).
Security and data integrity: SQL injection attempt (TC12) and handling of special characters (TC19).
State variation scenarios: bundle with no existing fields (TC22), update existing fields (TC23), partial updates (TC24), backward compatibility with older clients (TC25).
Performance and resilience: normal load (TC17), peak load (TC18), and recovery from transient network failures (TC21).
Integration and fault tolerance: dependent service unavailability (TC11) and inconsistent data from dependent service (TC20).
gaps: 403 Forbidden (insufficient permissions) is not explicitly tested (only 401 covered).
Rate limiting/throttling (429) scenarios are not tested.
Caching behavior for PUT (ETag/Cache-Control) is not tested.
Observability: no tests for logging/metrics/tracing for this endpoint.
PATCH/DELETE methods are not part of this story and lack coverage (not required for PUT).
recommendations: Add a 403 Forbidden test to cover insufficient permissions scenarios.
Introduce rate-limiting tests (429) for the endpoint to validate throttling behavior.
Add tests for caching semantics on PUT (ETag/Cache-Control) to validate cache invalidation or consistency.
Create explicit concurrency-conflict tests (beyond throughput tests) to detect race conditions when multiple clients update the same bundle simultaneously.
Incorporate observability tests (metrics/logs/tracing) to monitor latency, error rates, and service health for this endpoint.
